metadata.synopsis: Speaking to Shadowheart at a reunion of all the companions six months after the Absolute was defeated. The circumstances under which the player is speaking to her differ depending on prior events - they could be lovers who have been spending the past while together, or they could be platonic and have not seen eachother in a while. There are variants for Shadowheart's overall arc also - if she sided with Shar or not, saved her parents or not etc.

19.speaker: Shadowheart
19.text: Lady Shar's blessings to you. Or perhaps you don't need them - you look well.
19.context: NodeContext: As pleased to see an old friend as a Sharran matriarch will allow herself. Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

641.speaker: Player
641.text: I look well? Most would say I'm positively godly.

925.speaker: Shadowheart
925.text: Most, perhaps. But I can hardly be paying compliments to my lady's competition now, can I?
925.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

417.speaker: Player
417.text: Mortals have certain expectations of the gods that I try to live up to. Besides, this is a special night.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: I'm not sure I have much use for a rival's blessings, but I'm glad you seem to be prospering in her shadow.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: Well, it's amazing what not sleeping rough covered in bloodstains will do for you.

982.speaker: Shadowheart
982.text: I couldn't agree more. Lady Shar's holy work is all-consuming - I doubt I'd manage without a feather bed to turn to.
982.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

307.speaker: Player
307.text: I made an effort. This is a special night, after all.

611.speaker: Shadowheart
611.text: Very much so. I couldn't bear to miss it, no matter how busy Lady Shar's work keeps me.
611.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

715.speaker: Shadowheart
715.text: Her entire church prospers. The Absolute washed the Sword Coast with blood and tears - it is now fertile ground for her message to flourish.
715.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

342.speaker: Player
342.text: I could say the same of you. Prospering at your lady's side, I take it?

110.speaker: Shadowheart
110.text: Very apt choice of words. But it doesn't just go for me; Lady Shar's entire church prospers. The Absolute washed the Sword Coast with blood and tears - it is now fertile ground for her message to flourish.
110.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

10.speaker: Shadowheart
10.text: Broken hearts, shaken faiths, refugees without homes, former cultists without purpose... they can all become the Nightsinger's children, with the right nudge.
10.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

351.speaker: Shadowheart
351.text: You should see how they flock to us. We spread like the night sky chasing the sun below the horizon.
351.context: NodeContext: Almost dreamy, thinking of looming triumphs. Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

648.speaker: Player
648.text: Hells, Shadowheart, it's a party. I'm a literal god and even I take pause from preaching now and again.

1022.speaker: Player
1022.text: Your mistress isn't the only beneficiary - mortals the world over are finding themselves drawn to yours truly.

938.speaker: Player
938.text: I'm glad you're thriving. Though a pity I couldn't be at your side as paramour.

1010.speaker: Shadowheart
1010.text: A pity, yes... but also for the best, perhaps. It would have pained me to have you close, but not be able to dedicate myself to you in every waking moment.
1010.context: NodeContext: rc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

738.speaker: Shadowheart
738.text: We would have been able to claim just enough of each other's hearts in order for it to hurt. Better to indulge ourselves fully whenever fate allows, than to live in compromise...
738.context: NodeContext: rc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

807.speaker: Player
807.text: You're no longer the same woman I fell for, are you?

837.speaker: Shadowheart
837.text: Nor are you the same person who fell for me. Time can be unkind to hearts in that sense, especially if you fear change.
837.context: NodeContext: rc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

76.speaker: Shadowheart
76.text: But don't worry. I'm sure you'll find there's still plenty to like, if you care to indulge...
76.context: NodeContext: rc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

535.speaker: Shadowheart
535.text: ... And tonight, of all nights, was made for indulgence.
535.context: NodeContext: rc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

534.speaker: Player
534.text: I've missed you. We don't see enough of each other.

870.speaker: Shadowheart
870.text: I don't know if that's strictly true... I think I saw just about every inch of you, when I last slipped away from my duties...
870.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

215.speaker: Shadowheart
215.text: I jest. You would think I'd be accustomed to loss, yet it stings all the same. Lady Shar may keep me occupied, but there is always a place in my heart and mind for you.
215.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

212.speaker: Shadowheart
212.text: But let's not grow maudlin - this is a celebration. Tell me what you've been doing with yourself.
212.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

326.speaker: Player
326.text: Perhaps being apart is what was best for both of us.

191.speaker: Shadowheart
191.text: You didn't seem to be of that mind when we last slipped away together. You couldn't get enough of me, as I recall.
191.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

140.speaker: Shadowheart
140.text: At least let's enjoy tonight, then I can leave you be once more. In time, you will feel the old yearning again, and darken my door.
140.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

812.speaker: Shadowheart
812.text: Now, tell me all. What have you been doing with yourself this past while?
812.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

854.speaker: Player
854.text: Do you think Shar will notice if I steal a kiss from you, for old time's sake?

748.speaker: Shadowheart
748.text: I'd like to think I'm cunning enough to get away with it. Come here to me...
748.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

871.speaker: Shadowheart
871.text: Like a rare vintage... bittersweet to taste so infrequently, yet always worth the wait.
871.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

859.speaker: Player
859.text: Despite its name, I can't imagine hugs are common in the Cloister of Sombre Embrace... may I?

573.speaker: Shadowheart
573.text: What, a show of sincere affection...?
573.context: NodeContext: Teasing - 'oh a hug? how kinky'. Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

994.speaker: Shadowheart
994.text: You're lucky none of my followers are around to witness this. Come here...
994.context: NodeContext: Teasing - 'oh a hug? how kinky'. Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

936.speaker: Shadowheart
936.text: Let's keep that our special secret. I have a reputation to maintain, you know.

518.speaker: Player
518.text: I can't criticise - you got what you wanted, and I helped you achieve it.

819.speaker: Shadowheart
819.text: You did, and I'll be forever grateful. I'll keep Lady Shar's followers away from your nascent church for as long as I can... give you a sporting chance.
819.context: NodeContext: 'You're alright. Don't come into town next tuesday' sort of friendly sentiment with an undercurrent of threat. Shar path SH speaking to God Gale.

487.speaker: Shadowheart
487.text: You did, and I'll be forever grateful. Perhaps one day, you may open your eyes to her wisdom yourself... but even if you do not, I shall make sure that the sharp edge of her spreading gospel does not trouble you.
487.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

447.speaker: Player
447.text: You know what? Good for you. I dare anyone to suggest you didn't earn this.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Don't you think you're exploiting all those people?

600.speaker: Shadowheart
600.text: You have worshippers of your own, Gale. Are you really in a position to judge? I'd have expected the god of ambition to understand that you must do whatever it takes.
600.context: NodeContext: Shar path SH speaking to God Gale.

515.speaker: Shadowheart
515.text: Everyone is exploited. Lowest gutter to highest throne, there's always someone above you pulling the strings. If you think otherwise, you aren't looking hard enough.
515.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

34.speaker: Shadowheart
34.text: If those people didn't come to me, who knows where they'd end up? Lady Shar provides food, shelter, training, purpose... and the wisdom  that one day, their pain will no longer matter.
34.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

303.speaker: Shadowheart
303.text: They have already been tempered by loss. They were meant to become her instruments.
303.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

187.speaker: Player
187.text: Hells, Shadowheart, it's a party. Get off the pulpit.

525.speaker: Shadowheart
525.text: Sorry. Every gathering is an opportunity when you're doing the Dark Lady's work.
525.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

450.speaker: Player
450.text: The sun tends to chase away the dark in turn though.

264.speaker: Shadowheart
264.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

920.speaker: Shadowheart
920.text: But enough of that for now - I won't have it said that I'm not capable of enjoying a fine night with good company. Tell me what you've been doing.
920.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

1044.speaker: Player
1044.text: Coming to terms with godhood, mostly. Though I slip into mortal guise now and again and have a little adventure.

374.speaker: Player
374.text: Oh you know, this, that, and the other. The usual godly matters.

884.speaker: Player
884.text: I've mostly been focused on establishing my domain. When you're the god of ambition, you can't be seen to do things by halves...

297.speaker: Shadowheart
297.text: Apart from give closure to a former lover, perhaps? Don't worry - I'm not upset. Lady Shar would likely have prised us away from each other even if you had remained.
297.context: NodeContext: A little wry. Gale bailed on former lover SH to go be a god, but its water under the bridge, and  she's dedicated to Shar now anyway.

527.speaker: Shadowheart
527.text: I can't imagine she'd be thrilled to hear I've been consorting with her competition, but between you and me... best of luck with your endeavours.

612.speaker: Shadowheart
612.text: Well I'd wish you luck, but my lady may not appreciate me encouraging the competition.

224.speaker: Shadowheart
224.text: But between you and me - good luck.
224.context: NodeContext: Stage whispers 'good luck' with a smile.

384.speaker: Player
384.text: Tell her you've been living a quiet existence, and you're very glad for it.

740.speaker: Shadowheart
740.text: I won't pretend I'm not a little jealous. Lady Shar is a demanding mistress - as is her right to be - but a little calm and solitude would be a tonic.
740.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

840.speaker: Player
840.text: Boast of adventures you've embarked on since you parted ways with her.

182.speaker: Shadowheart
182.text: You've been busy! Careful you don't pull a muscle - I'm not there to nurse you back to health any more.
182.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

888.speaker: Player
888.text: Oh, you know. This and that.

664.speaker: Shadowheart
664.text: Ooh, you utter tease. I suppose I, of all people, can't begrudge you your secrets.
664.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

336.speaker: Player
336.text: I have been tempering myself in battle across the Astral Sea, weakening the lich queen's grip on the throne with every thrust of my blade.

467.speaker: Shadowheart
467.text: No interest in a little respite then? I won't claim to be surprised - you never struck me as the sort to rest on her laurels, Lae'zel.

681.speaker: Player
681.text: I have explored the harshest lands of the Sword Coast, piercing the hearts of the lich queen's countless assassins.

113.speaker: Shadowheart
113.text: You would think Vlaakith would understand by now that it would take more than a few cutthroats to best you.

158.speaker: Shadowheart
158.text: But no matter - I'm quite content to let her ranks of minions dwindle against the edge of your blade.

954.speaker: Shadowheart
954.text: I suppose you'll be keen to do the rounds, with so many old acquaintances gathered. Do not let me hoard your time.
954.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

246.speaker: Shadowheart
246.text: But don't be such a stranger either, in future. You know where to find me - I can always make some time for an old friend. One of the privileges of being in charge.
246.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

680.speaker: Player
680.text: So long as your mistress hasn't bid you to try lure her rivals into a trap or something...

391.speaker: Shadowheart
391.text: Oh you're far too cunning to fall for that. Consider Lady Shar's cloister your safe sanctuary, for as long as it answers to me.
391.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

545.speaker: Player
545.text: Someone of your prowess should really be following the God of Ambition, if I can be so bold as to suggest it.

657.speaker: Shadowheart
657.text: I've got my own private wine cellar now - I'll keep a special vintage aside for your visit.
657.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

640.speaker: Shadowheart
640.text: And should one thing lead to another, well... we all deserve to be wicked, now and again.
640.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Romantic flow, with SH having an occasional romance whenever she manages to step away from her duties (long distance relationship sort of feel)

694.speaker: Player
694.text: So long as you don't try to convert me - or worse.

866.speaker: Player
866.text: Sounds like you should take a leave from your duties, come join me for a while.

119.speaker: Shadowheart
119.text: Would that I could. But this is my life now. Lady Shar must come first - always.
119.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

915.speaker: Player
915.text: As you mentioned it just before, what's it like being Mother Superior?

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: All-consuming. Endless decisions to make, underlings jockeying for your attention, threats from the outside, threats from the inside... there's times I miss when it was just our little group against the odds.
2.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

1028.speaker: Shadowheart
1028.text: Simplicity is a luxury that's drifted out of my reach, I'm afraid. But at least for tonight, I can have a taste of how it used to be.
1028.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Do you ever think about your predecessor?

251.speaker: Shadowheart
251.text: I shouldn't... but from time to time, yes. Holding the office she once held, standing within the shadow of Lady Shar herself... It complicates my feelings towards her.
251.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

292.speaker: Shadowheart
292.text: I came to see her as an adversary, an obstacle, but what recourse did she have? What did she see when she looked at me?
292.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

335.speaker: Shadowheart
335.text: A future in which she was discarded, where the reward for her service and sacrifice was to groom her own replacement?

159.speaker: Shadowheart
159.text: What transpired was the Dark Lady's will. If time rolled back, I would do the same thing all over again, without hesitation... yet I am not without sympathy.
159.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

375.speaker: Shadowheart
375.text: Almost as busy as I am - such rapid growth creates a good deal of work for a quartermaster. So many lost souls, in need of dark cloaks... she has risen to the occasion though, as I knew she would.

771.speaker: Shadowheart
771.text: Sometimes she fears the others will grow jealous; that I see her as a favourite - well it's true, I do.

844.speaker: Shadowheart
844.text: They can challenge me on the matter if they dare... though none are so bold.

660.speaker: Player
660.text: I can't imagine hugs are all that common in the Cloister of Sombre Embrace... may I?

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Come here. I want another hug.

956.speaker: Shadowheart
956.text: Well it'd be cruel of me to deny you...

968.speaker: Shadowheart
968.text: My, I think you've gotten stronger.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Do you think Shar will notice if I steal a kiss from you, for old time's sake?

752.speaker: Shadowheart
752.text: Luckily for both of us, I'm well-versed in stealth. Come here...

643.speaker: Player
643.text: Might I trouble you for another kiss?

646.speaker: Shadowheart
646.text: Only if you leave me feeling lightheaded.

885.speaker: Shadowheart
885.text: I might need a few more of those, before the sun threatens to rise.

905.speaker: Player
905.text: Settling back into Waterdeep, catching up on my reading. I've even indulged in a spot of teaching...

39.speaker: Shadowheart
39.text: Helping shape the minds of future generations, is it? Just be sure to steer them far away from dabbling in Netherese magic...

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I've indulged in the odd spot of magical mischief. Nothing cataclysmic though - I assure you.

719.speaker: Shadowheart
719.text: I should hope not - if any city-sized craters should appear in Faerûn, I'll know who to blame.

751.speaker: Player
751.text: Rebuilding Baldur's Gate. Playing Duke is as all-consuming a role as being the Blade. And Mizora isn't shy about bending my ear...

948.speaker: Shadowheart
948.text: Mmm, yes. Shy is indeed not a word I'd reach for, when it comes to her. I'm glad the city has you as a steadying influence - just don't solve all its problems, or I'll be short of new recruits.

774.speaker: Player
774.text: Rebuilding Baldur's Gate. Playing Duke is as all-consuming a role as being the Blade.

803.speaker: Shadowheart
803.text: People never talk about just how exhausting power can be, do they? But I'm glad the city has you as a steadying influence - just don't solve all its problems, or I'll be short of new recruits.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I've been using my infernal powers in service of good, working to keep the Sword Coast safe.

271.speaker: Shadowheart
271.text: And building up quite the reputation for yourself as well, no doubt? I've seen more than a few children playing as you on the streets, brandishing sticks at each other.

628.speaker: Player
628.text: I've been doing what I do best - keeping the Sword Coast safe.

746.speaker: Player
746.text: Avernus is my hunting ground now - I've been putting my infernal powers to good use there.

521.speaker: Player
521.text: The Blade has been busy - Avernus is my hunting ground now.

911.speaker: Shadowheart
911.text: I'm sure you have no shortage of challenges there. I can only imagine what your trophy wall must look like - assuming you keep trophies. Or have a wall, for that matter.

503.speaker: Player
503.text: Avernus is my hunting ground now, but at least I have Karlach for company.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Avernus is my hunting ground now, but at least I have Karlach for company.

839.speaker: Shadowheart
839.text: It's good that you two have each other. Fitting perhaps; you left there a hunter and quarry, and return as allies and friends.

229.speaker: Shadowheart
229.text: But I'll leave such notions for the bards to pick over - not appropriate for someone of my standing to indulge in sentiment. Or at least, not often.

999.speaker: Player
999.text: I've been revelling in my freedom, rediscovering the joys of the night.

445.speaker: Shadowheart
445.text: And what better to revel in, than Lady Shar's umbral bliss? Just be careful to not overindulge - drain too many maidens and young bucks, and you may find a mob breaking down your door.

1043.speaker: Player
1043.text: I've mostly been hiding, making sure Cazador can't find me.

511.speaker: Shadowheart
511.text: There's great virtue in stealth. Perhaps you can help train some of my initiates in the future. I can repay you in any juicy morsels who fail to pass muster.

974.speaker: Player
974.text: Well I've been enjoying parties, plots, and plenty of hedonism. Nothing that would surprise you, really.

507.speaker: Shadowheart
507.text: Not in the slightest, no. But I am glad to hear it, nonetheless.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Trying to survive, mainly. It's hard, but I'm managing.

772.speaker: Shadowheart
772.text: I have little doubt. Only the strongest of hearts could endure such challenges and maintain even a sliver of your good cheer.

348.speaker: Player
348.text: Literally nothing. I don't know how people live without divine guidance.

90.speaker: Shadowheart
90.text: Don't worry - even the most lost souls will find their way to Lady Shar's embrace, in the end.

942.speaker: Player
942.text: I visited Candlekeep to research Bhaalspawn history. The librarians really fussed over me.

143.speaker: Shadowheart
143.text: Can you blame them? It must be like meeting their literary hero - or anti-hero, I suppose.

597.speaker: Player
597.text: My new form has dictated that I live a quiet existence, far from prying eyes and panicky hearts.

932.speaker: Shadowheart
932.text: Understandable. But rest assured that your secret is safe with me. Lady Shar respects those who live in the shadows.

404.speaker: Player
404.text: My new form has dictated that I live a discreet existence, yet not one without ambition. The Emperor and I are close collaborators.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: My new form has dictated that I live a discreet existence, yet not one without ambition. The Emperor and I are close collaborators.

787.speaker: Shadowheart
787.text: Intriguing. Yet I hope your ambitions don't grow so great that we find ourselves at odds. I would hate for you to force my hand for the sake of Lady Shar's interests.

566.speaker: Player
566.text: Much as I fear your lady's blessings, I'll take it. Good to see you too, buddy.

35.speaker: Shadowheart
35.text: Oh, do not fear them - there's no point in fearing the inevitable.
35.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

234.speaker: Shadowheart
234.text: In any case, I am glad you made it - tonight is not to be missed. Tonight is for celebrating.

472.speaker: Shadowheart
472.text: And at the risk of sounding boastful, I think we have plenty to celebrate; Lady Shar's entire church prospers. The Absolute washed the Sword Coast with blood and tears - it is now fertile ground for her message to flourish.

309.speaker: Player
309.text: A fair assessment. Faerûn has proved tolerable.

707.speaker: Shadowheart
707.text: Coming from you, that's high praise. The continent ought to be flattered.
707.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

399.speaker: Player
399.text: Of course - I am flush with battle-joy. The scent of foes' spilled blood and loosened bowels lingers in my nostrils still.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: How... descriptive of you. But I suppose that counts as thriving, by your yardstick.
42.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I'm glad to hear you say so; days spent bent over books are rarely conducive to a healthy glow or an ache-free back.

736.speaker: Shadowheart
736.text: I'm glad you managed to pull yourself away from your leatherbound harem then.
736.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: Indeed? Perhaps the free-roaming lifestyle has lent a raffish glow to my cheeks.

377.speaker: Shadowheart
377.text: You may very well be right. Perhaps you'll become the subject of books in years to come, rather than the avid consumer of them.
377.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

912.speaker: Player
912.text: Is that supposed to be funny? I've been crouched in sewers, sucking on vermin!

311.speaker: Shadowheart
311.text: Well, you pull it off admirably, I must admit. I'm sure you'll find plenty who'll fawn at the idea of a romantic fugitive.
311.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Well I may miss the sun, but there's been plenty of creature comforts to avail of.

913.speaker: Shadowheart
913.text: I think we both know the darkness is far superior anyway. Besides, the flicker of candlelight truly brings out your cheekbones.

835.speaker: Player
835.text: I should hope so - imagine going through all the bother of ascending just to look dowdy.

973.speaker: Shadowheart
973.text: Perish the thought. You are right to look the part - I know the importance of appearances in maintaining your grasp of power all too well.

390.speaker: Player
390.text: Inner peace suits me, I suppose.

439.speaker: Shadowheart
439.text: And suits the populace, I daresay. They've probably had their fill of butchered corpses in the streets.
439.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

708.speaker: Player
708.text: Better than some foes I've left in my wake, at least - the Blade's been busy.

508.speaker: Shadowheart
508.text: So I have heard - just be sure to keep it far from Lady Shar's holy work. Even the sharpest blade can be dulled against her power.

661.speaker: Player
661.text: A requirement of my title - if I'm to call myself Duke, I have to set an example and look suitably prosperous.

608.speaker: Shadowheart
608.text: Nobility suits you. I've been sure to keep some discreet eyes on your progress - their reports have been very complimentary.

564.speaker: Player
564.text: I look better than some of the foes I've left behind in Avernus, at least.

248.speaker: Shadowheart
248.text: I have little doubt. But you can give your sword arm a rest - tonight is for celebrating.
248.context: NodeContext: Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

353.speaker: Player
353.text: You jest, surely? I sport more tentacles than a fishmonger's window.

465.speaker: Shadowheart
465.text: So modest. You and I both know your visage is a mark of pride - it denotes fearlessness, tenacity, a capacity for self-sacrifice that would make most hearts quake.
465.context: NodeContext: Sincere in her praise. Arc; Shadowheart remained loyal to Shar. She sacrificed her parents and now leads Shar's church. Platonic flow, reuniting with the player after six months.

213.speaker: Shadowheart
213.text: I was starting to wonder if you'd show up.
213.context: NodeContext: Gently teasing/'look what the cat dragged in'. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

275.speaker: Player
275.text: Of course. I may be a god, but that doesn't mean I've forgotten my friends.

822.speaker: Shadowheart
822.text: I suppose it can't be easy making friends amongst the gods, being the pantheon's newest arrival.
822.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

696.speaker: Player
696.text: There was never any doubt, Hells or not. I've missed you.

165.speaker: Shadowheart
165.text: Likewise. And I'm glad at least one of us was confident in your return - it hasn't always been easy, wondering if something might've happened to you and Karlach in that place...

626.speaker: Player
626.text: I'm sorry for keeping you in suspense then. I've missed you.

3.speaker: Shadowheart
3.text: As have I. And I'm particularly glad to see you haven't tumbled off the back of a red dragon or gotten yourself skewered in some distant battle. It hasn't been easy, not knowing...

438.speaker: Shadowheart
438.text: ... but perhaps I should have known better than to doubt. It is you we're talking about, after all. Come here, will you?

510.speaker: Player
510.text: Are you joking? I've been counting down the days.

310.speaker: Shadowheart
310.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

429.speaker: Player
429.text: I had reservations, actually. I thought it might be too bittersweet.

588.speaker: Shadowheart
588.text: In all likelihood, it will be... but we mustn't let that stop us.
588.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

582.speaker: Player
582.text: Of course I did - you lot could hardly manage without me.

814.speaker: Shadowheart
814.text: You can say that with a straight face after all the times I had to come to your aid?
814.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

1019.speaker: Shadowheart
1019.text: Hilarious. You could find work as a jester, if you stumble upon a noble with more gold than taste.
1019.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

671.speaker: Player
671.text: I was wondering the same of you. I didn't think you'd want to be within arm's reach of me again.

177.speaker: Shadowheart
177.text: What can I say? We shared something extraordinary, even if we didn't always see eye to eye. Let's leave old squabbles in the past.
177.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

22.speaker: Shadowheart
22.text: Oh, come here, will you? It's been forever.
22.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

586.speaker: Shadowheart
586.text: Hmm, you feel a little more substantial than before. Less camping and scrounging off the land, I take it?
586.context: NodeContext: Post hug (normal pose) Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

950.speaker: Player
950.text: Naturally. The god of ambition has an ambitious larder to match. I'm not exactly fighting for scraps.

1014.speaker: Player
1014.text: You can say that again. Why lie in the dirt, gazing up at the stars, when you can slumber amongst them?

927.speaker: Player
927.text: Avernus has some interesting pantries to rifle through, sure.

296.speaker: Player
296.text: You can say that again. I've slept under the stars enough for one lifetime.

642.speaker: Shadowheart
642.text: I'm not entirely sure I'd agree - in fact, I found a nice meadow not far from where I live now. Every now and again, I'll spend the night there. For old time's sake.
642.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

770.speaker: Player
770.text: You can say that again. I've slept under the stars enough for one lifetime.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: You know, I miss that, actually.

288.speaker: Shadowheart
288.text: Same - in fact, I found a nice meadow not far from where I live now. Every now and again, I'll spend the night there. For old time's sake.
288.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

95.speaker: Shadowheart
95.text: Filled-out and healthy, is what I was going for. Don't tell me you miss living off whatever scraps we found in crates and barrels.
95.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

861.speaker: Player
861.text: I'll take that as a compliment. You look good too.

173.speaker: Shadowheart
173.text: I suppose I do, don't I?
173.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: Nonsense - I am as disciplined as ever.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Drivel. I am as battle-hardened as ever. Feel the strength of my sword arm, the tautness of my abdominals...

800.speaker: Shadowheart
800.text: No offence intended - quite the contrary, in fact.
800.context: NodeContext: Lighthearted/sincere. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: Hardly - campaigning at Lae'zel's side against Vlaakith is no picnic. Makes me pine for the good old days.

605.speaker: Player
605.text: I'm not sure how much you truly want to know about my diet, but I've been getting by just fine.

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: Fair point. I'm not quite sure this evening's refreshments will be to your tastes, but hopefully the company will make up for it.
67.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a mind flayer player. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

773.speaker: Shadowheart
773.text: It's good to see you again, even if only for a short while.
773.context: NodeContext: Sincere/bit of longing. Reunited with old flame

200.speaker: Shadowheart
200.text: I'm glad you made it, even if just for tonight.
200.context: NodeContext: Sincere/bit of longing. Reunited with old flame

355.speaker: Shadowheart
355.text: I'm glad you seem well. Truly.
355.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

788.speaker: Player
788.text: Six months without a kiss from you... it's been agony. May I?

975.speaker: Shadowheart
975.text: I was starting to think you'd never ask...

37.speaker: Shadowheart
37.text: That was more than worth the wait.

901.speaker: Player
901.text: I should have kissed you more, when I had the chance. May I?

604.speaker: Shadowheart
604.text: I had no doubt, but I'm glad to hear you say it, all the same.

957.speaker: Shadowheart
957.text: Oh don't be such a grumpy rothé - being sentimental is what parties are for. Give it some time - you'll loosen up as the night progresses.

825.speaker: Player
825.text: Tell me what you've been up to.

797.speaker: Shadowheart
797.text: I found a little cottage; abandoned, half-ruined - there's a lot of such places to be found, thanks to the Absolute's armies. I've been making it my own.
797.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

537.speaker: Player
537.text: Sounds very cosy. I can't wait to warm myself under a blanket with you, next to the fireplace.

385.speaker: Player
385.text: Sounds very cosy. I can't wait to warm myself under a blanket with you, next to the fireplace.

892.speaker: Shadowheart
892.text: Neither can I, but be warned - you'll need to be willing to share with the lodgers.
892.context: NodeContext: Faux warning (referring to all her animals) Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: It's harder work than I'd expected, actually. I'll never take vegetables for granted after all the effort it's taken to grow a few, but still... it's mine. Well, mine and the lodgers.
29.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

56.speaker: Shadowheart
56.text: Four dogs, eight cats, nine chickens, six pigeons, four sheep, a milk cow named Daphne, a squirrel who's far too clever for her own good, and a wolf cub I found orphaned in some woods.
56.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

333.speaker: Player
333.text: Quite a gathering - I hope you've saved a spot for me.

254.speaker: Shadowheart
254.text: Of course, the cats have just been keeping your side of the bed warm for you. You may need to leave any dragon steeds behind when you return though - wouldn't want to tempt fate.

457.speaker: Player
457.text: Quite a gathering - I hope you've saved a spot for me.

918.speaker: Shadowheart
918.text: Of course, the cats have just been keeping your side of the bed warm for you. They may not be appreciative of the Hells-scent on you, but nothing a good scrub can't remedy.

693.speaker: Player
693.text: That's a lot of animals. Your hands must be cramped from all the petting.

233.speaker: Shadowheart
233.text: I've had to do far worse things with my hands, trust me. This is no burden at all. I don't think I've ever slept more soundly than I have with my menagerie of beasts for company.
233.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

756.speaker: Shadowheart
756.text: Just don't tell Halsin that, or he'll want an invitation.
756.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

477.speaker: Player
477.text: Safe to say you've left your fear of wolves in the past, then?

933.speaker: Shadowheart
933.text: He's just a frightened little pup - he has no idea what he'll grow up to be. And maybe with me there to guide him... who knows what he'll become? It's amazing what can happen, with the right nurturing.
933.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

1013.speaker: Shadowheart
1013.text: I've called him Buttons, because he has different-coloured eyes, like buttons on a rag doll.
1013.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

380.speaker: Player
380.text: Your home must smell, um, rustic...

710.speaker: Shadowheart
710.text: Oh, like a barn. I bathed three times before tonight just to be safe, and cleared out the apothecaries of rosewater and incense.
710.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

575.speaker: Player
575.text: A little sedate, after all we've been through, no?

437.speaker: Shadowheart
437.text: Sedate is exactly what I've needed. It's harder than I'd expected, actually. I'll never take vegetables for granted after all the effort it's taken to grow a few, but still... it's mine. Well, mine and the lodgers.
437.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

291.speaker: Shadowheart
291.text: You can come as soon as you please, so long as the lodgers approve of you.
291.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

607.speaker: Player
607.text: I find it hard to picture you as some sort of homesteader.

344.speaker: Shadowheart
344.text: I feel the same, honestly. The woman in the mirror looks unfamiliar sometimes - but she looks happy. And she has plenty of company as well.
344.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

758.speaker: Shadowheart
758.text: Healing. Learning to live again. It's hard to think of all that was robbed from them, but they're intent on making every day count for double.
758.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

522.speaker: Shadowheart
522.text: My mother's mind still drifts every now and again, but she has more good days than not-so-good days. She taught me her recipe for apple and plum pie, and when I tasted it, I actually remembered it, from when I was a little girl.
522.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

114.speaker: Shadowheart
114.text: Some things can't be taken from you, it seems.
114.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

653.speaker: Shadowheart
653.text: Father's making himself useful; helping me fix up the cottage, and caring for the animals. His wolf form is very useful in helping Buttons to acclimatise; I think part of him wishes I'd ended up a lycanthrope as well.
653.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

577.speaker: Shadowheart
577.text: And I've been telling them about you of course - how brave and selfless you were, going to the Hells with Karlach. And a lot more besides; you're my favourite topic.
577.context: NodeContext:  SH turned from Shar/saved her parents.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Not sharing anything too embarassing, I hope?

704.speaker: Shadowheart
704.text: Oh no, of course not. I'll need you to be there in person that - see if I can make you squirm.
704.context: NodeContext: Teasing/lighthearted. SH turned from Shar/saved her parents.

594.speaker: Player
594.text: Sounds like they might have lofty expectations of me. I hope I'll live up to them.

318.speaker: Shadowheart
318.text: Don't worry; you'll surpass them without even trying. They know everything you did. For Baldur's Gate. For me.
318.context: NodeContext: Sincere/appreciative. SH turned from Shar and saved her parents.

720.speaker: Player
720.text: Understandable. I am fascinating. And witty. Easy on the eyes. A sharp dresser. I smell quite nice...

896.speaker: Shadowheart
896.text: Oh of course, all that and more. But it's your modesty that I truly admire the most...
896.context: NodeContext: Amused chuckle at the player's joke-bragging. SH turned from Shar and saved her parents.

550.speaker: Shadowheart
550.text: And I've been telling them about you of course - how brave and selfless you were, joining Lae'zel. That, and a lot more besides; you're my favourite topic.
550.context: NodeContext:  SH turned from Shar/saved her parents.

282.speaker: Shadowheart
282.text: Sorry, I'm rambling. Family life and pastry recipes probably aren't the most interesting topics for such a historic reunion.
282.context: NodeContext: Catching herself, slightlu embarassed. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: After everything we pulled off together, a little slice of normalcy sounds like just the thing - even to the god of ambition.

431.speaker: Shadowheart
431.text: As am I - and no small bit surprised, also. Part of me's afraid I'll wake from the dream and find myself back in the wilds, or worse, at the cloister. But no... it's real.
431.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

436.speaker: Player
436.text: After everything we pulled off together, a little slice of normalcy sounds like just the thing.

332.speaker: Shadowheart
332.text: I couldn't have said it better myself. Just be sure to take your own advice whenever you can? You've earned it.
332.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

1039.speaker: Player
1039.text: Well, you always did like the sound of your own voice.

768.speaker: Shadowheart
768.text: Of course I do - everything sounds good when I say it.
768.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

270.speaker: Player
270.text: Prove it - say 'Ugh, the latrine's overflowing again - watch your step'.

883.speaker: Shadowheart
883.text: Ugh, the latrine's overflowing again - watch your step... oh I truly hope you're not speaking from experience.
883.context: NodeContext: Just about keeps it together the first half, then gives way to a giggle

449.speaker: Player
449.text: Let's put that theory to the test. Repeat after me: 'With a little bit of spittle, chew your vittles, then play skittles'.

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.context: NodeContext: Deadpan/knows the player's found her krytonite - the dreaded 'little',

841.speaker: Shadowheart
841.text: Ugh, fine... with a little bit of spittle, chew your vittles, then play skittles

20.speaker: Shadowheart
20.text: Congratulations - I think I've sprained my tongue.

334.speaker: Shadowheart
334.text: Another time perhaps. Some undefined time in the far, distant future.

632.speaker: Player
632.text: Demand she prove her point, and whisper a phrase for her to repeat.

665.speaker: Shadowheart
665.text: ... what the Hells does that mean?
665.context: NodeContext: Perplexed. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

513.speaker: Player
513.text: The last words of an infamous githyanki heretic, publicly executed generations ago by Vlaakith LXXIV.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: The final, profane ravings of someone who gave in to madness, and worship of a false god.

86.speaker: Shadowheart
86.context: NodeContext: Unsure, but going along with it. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

955.speaker: Shadowheart
955.text: ... I may be a hater and a gatekeeper, but I'm also god's favourite princess, and the most interesting girl in the world.
955.context: NodeContext: Reciting a sacred phrase. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

906.speaker: Shadowheart
906.text: Mad as a sack of shaken geese, clearly. No wonder they got rid of her.
906.context: NodeContext: Perplexed/amused. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

406.speaker: Player
406.text: The meaning is unimportant - the challenge is what matters.

785.speaker: Shadowheart
785.text: Some strange githyanki adage, I assume? I'm not sure I want to know...
785.context: NodeContext: Perplexed/amused. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

937.speaker: Shadowheart
937.text: Father's making himself useful; helping me fix up the cottage, and caring for the animals - you should see the amount I have now. He's been waiting years for this; now he can't stop smiling.
937.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

490.speaker: Player
490.text: Does Shar's curse still torment you?

780.speaker: Shadowheart
780.text: The pain still comes from time to time, but I won't let her torment me. I won't let her take any more from me. She's had more than enough already - now she can dwell in her beloved darkness, ignored.
780.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

847.speaker: Shadowheart
847.text: Sorry. I've found that happiness is an active thing. You have to fight for it every day, like you would a battle. I won't give her the satisfaction ever again.
847.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents lived.

776.speaker: Player
776.text: Tell me what you've been up to.

242.speaker: Player
242.text: Tell me what you've been up to.

321.speaker: Shadowheart
321.text: Wandering, mostly. The adventuring life is almost a tonic when you're not constantly threatened by brain monsters and cultists. I can finally see the world beyond the Cloister.
321.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

561.speaker: Player
561.text: Come on, tell all. Where have you been? What have you seen?

998.speaker: Player
998.text: I thought you might crave a little peace and quiet, after all that happened.

794.speaker: Shadowheart
794.text: Peace and quiet will still be there waiting once I've lived a little. Though don't get me wrong - I've got a little cottage with a garden and animals in mind already.
794.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

980.speaker: Shadowheart
980.text: One of my first stops was the House of the Moon, in Waterdeep. It's the largest temple of Selûne in existence.
980.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

387.speaker: Shadowheart
387.text: It seemed like the perfect spot to reflect on my parents, on where they came from - and where I came from too, I suppose.
387.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

563.speaker: Shadowheart
563.text: Hard to imagine, isn't it? Me, of all people, in the lair of the 'Moon Witch' herself. Gods, your truest act of heroism was putting up with all that Sharran drivel I was spouting for so long.
563.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

552.speaker: Player
552.text: Your parents would be proud of you.

289.speaker: Shadowheart
289.text: Oh, I know they are. I can still sense them, I think. And one day, we'll be reunited.
289.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

1020.speaker: Player
1020.text: What else have you been doing?

735.speaker: Shadowheart
735.text: Well, I've had run-ins with my former fellow Sharrans on a couple of occasions. Word seems to have spread of what happened at the Cloister - now other chapters of Shar worshippers see me as a prime target to offer up to their lady as a sacrifice.

434.speaker: Shadowheart
434.text: Don't worry. I know their tired old tricks better than anyone - they'll need more than a hooded cloak and poisoned blade to best me. Especially when I have a friend on the inside keeping me abreast of their predictable little plans.

469.speaker: Player
469.text: A friend on the inside? You mean Nocturne?

146.speaker: Shadowheart
146.text: None other. The matter of her faith and allegiances remains... complicated, let's say, but she is still my oldest friend.

305.speaker: Shadowheart
305.text: I have hopes that perhaps she might turn from Shar entirely, given time, but that's a decision she will have to make for herself. If that day comes, I'll be ready.

779.speaker: Player
779.text: Just keep safe - don't do anything I wouldn't.

793.speaker: Shadowheart
793.text: You saved the world - that doesn't leave much off the table. But point taken - I'll be as cautious as a cat with eight lives spent.

623.speaker: Shadowheart
623.text: Don't worry. I know their tired old tricks better than anyone - they'll need more than a hooded cloak and poisoned blade to best me.

57.speaker: Shadowheart
57.text: Who's to say? Perhaps I'll set out on a new adventure of my own while I await your return. I can hardly be expected to take up knitting while you have all the fun, can I?
57.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky/'maybe I'll have some fun of my own'

131.speaker: Shadowheart
131.text: But that can wait for now - come on, tell me everything. What have you been up to?

441.speaker: Shadowheart
441.text: I don't know - which is just the way I like it just now. Perhaps I'll just stick a pin in a map and see what I find, or head to the docks in the morning and scrounge a berth to somewhere new.
441.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

842.speaker: Shadowheart
842.text: I'd like to see the islands maybe, or head south to Amn. I heard there's an enclave of werecats that hunt the followers of dark gods by moonlight. I'd love to see if there's any truth to that.
842.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

402.speaker: Shadowheart
402.text: But enough about me - what have you been up to?

543.speaker: Player
543.text: You're right, I was truly heroic.

766.speaker: Shadowheart
766.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

991.speaker: Player
991.text: Are you going to turn to Selûnite rhetoric now instead?

312.speaker: Shadowheart
312.text: Not quite. But luckily Selûne allows you to forge your own path. Perhaps I'll be drawn to her, perhaps not. Either way, I get to decide. That's not something I was ever able to claim before.
312.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

167.speaker: Player
167.text: You were in Waterdeep? A shame you didn't call in on Gale and I.

981.speaker: Shadowheart
981.text: I wanted to, truly, but I suspected someone with ill intent was tailing me. I didn't want to lead them to your door.
981.context: NodeContext: Sheepish/some regret. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

269.text: I'd left the city by the time they made their move - don't worry, they proved no challenge. You might still spot crows pecking at Sharran bones on the road to Daggerford.
269.context: NodeContext: Fears were well founded. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

674.text: Next time, I'll visit properly - and without any uninvited tagalongs. You both can give me the grand tour.
674.context: NodeContext: Determined/upbeat. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

392.speaker: Shadowheart
392.text: We had tea on his balcony - Tara even deigned to sit on my lap for a while. You know, I think entire forests must have been felled to quench that man's thirst for books.

273.text: It sounds like you're doing right by yourself.

1009.speaker: Shadowheart

1009.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

473.text: It's a privilege to have memories - even bad ones. They've moulded me into the person I am. As have you, come to think about it.
473.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

382.speaker: Shadowheart

382.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

347.text: Tell me what you've been up to.
347.context: InternalNodeContext: Currently flagged to only support in hells with Karlach as it's likely the other nodes are impossible

845.speaker: Shadowheart
845.text: Raising hells with Karlach in Avernus, of course. I'm surprised you can't smell the brimstone on me.

702.speaker: Shadowheart
702.text: I wish I could see more of my parents, but we get by, and they're doing well for themselves. Perhaps one day both Karlach and I will be able to return for good.

584.speaker: Shadowheart
584.text: It's not exactly the quiet life, but perhaps after all that happened with my parents, it's for the best if I keep busy. Still though, I hope Karlach and I can return for good some day.

128.speaker: Shadowheart
128.text: But until then, I'm glad to be by her side - or thrown over her shoulder on occasion, if the odds turn against us.

678.speaker: Shadowheart
678.text: Between you and me, I've pretended to have a sprained ankle now and again, for a ride on those muscles.
678.context: NodeContext: Conspiratorial, said with a smile

699.speaker: Shadowheart
699.text: But enough about me - what have you been doing?

649.speaker: Shadowheart
649.text: It's not exactly the quiet life, but perhaps after all that happened, it's for the best if I keep busy. Still though, I hope Karlach and I can return for good some day.

668.speaker: Shadowheart
668.text: At Wyll's side in Avernus of course - be it in the heat of battle or the heat of the bedroll...

231.speaker: Shadowheart
231.text: ... sorry, am I oversharing? I don't get much practice at polite conversation in that place, as I'm sure you can imagine.
231.context: NodeContext: Catching herself with an embarassed laugh

122.speaker: Shadowheart
122.text: I wish I could see more of my parents, but we get by, and they're doing well for themselves. Perhaps one day both Wyll and I will be able to return for good.

562.speaker: Shadowheart
562.text: Until then, I'm right where I'm supposed to be - with the man I love.

601.speaker: Shadowheart
601.text: It's not exactly the quiet life, but perhaps after all that happened with my parents, it's for the best if I keep busy. Still though, I hope Wyll and I can return for good some day.

865.speaker: Shadowheart
865.text: At Wyll's side, of course. Honestly, I'm still not used to being married - it's almost a surprise, every morning that I wake next to him. But a very pleasant surprise.

462.speaker: Shadowheart
462.text: And I get to see my parents almost every day - I need to make every moment with them count, after so much was stolen from us. But they're doing well, and are very pleased to have a son-in-law.

276.speaker: Shadowheart
276.text: Who knows? Perhaps they'll have grandchildren before long.

827.speaker: Shadowheart
827.text: I only wish my parents could have met him properly... but I think they know I'm happy. I can feel their presence, when the moon is full.

701.speaker: Shadowheart
701.text: Fighting at Lae'zel's side. Vlaakith is clinging to power, but the tide is turning in our favour, battle by battle.

99.speaker: Shadowheart
99.text: I'm not quite used to riding on a dragon with Lae'zel yet - I tend to cling to her waist for dear life. She makes the beast do barrel rolls every now and again to make me squeal.

363.speaker: Shadowheart
363.text: I wish I could see more of my parents, but we manage to stay in touch. They're well, settled at a cottage I found for them. Perhaps one day Lae'zel will have her fill of battle, and we can go join them for good.

979.speaker: Shadowheart
979.text: I wonder what my parents would make of it, if they could see me. I'd like to think they'd be glad I was happy.

59.speaker: Shadowheart
59.text: I've been at Astarion's side. You'll have to forgive me if you catch me yawning - this is the latest in a very long line of parties. He takes 'no rest for the wicked' very seriously.

966.speaker: Shadowheart
966.text: My parents are close enough that I get to see them regularly - a little cottage, outside the city. I need to make every moment with them count, after so much was stolen from us.

967.speaker: Shadowheart
967.text: Probably for the best that my parents aren't around to see me now - I'm not quite sure they'd approve of my choice of lover...

992.speaker: Shadowheart
992.text: I've been at Astarion's side. You'll have to forgive me if you catch me yawning - given his aversion to the sun, we've had to keep unsocial hours in order to make the best of each other's company.

261.speaker: Shadowheart
261.text: That, or very heavy drapes. But Astarion's fussy about his decor, so the cover of darkness is often the easiest option.

228.speaker: Player
228.text: You must be wondering what I've been doing this past while.

426.speaker: Shadowheart
426.text: Must I...? You presume a great deal.
426.context: NodeContext: Hint of the OG Shadowheart sass, Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

761.context: NodeContext: Breaks off into a smile. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

675.text: Oh, you know. This, that, the other, and a few more things besides. Godly matters.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I've mostly been focused on establishing my domain. When you're the god of ambition, you can't be seen to do things by halves...

202.speaker: Shadowheart
202.text: That wouldn't have been your style even when you were just a man, would it?
202.context: NodeContext: Addresed to Gale. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents died, and she's been free of Shar's curse, exploring and adventuring

1027.speaker: Shadowheart

92.text: They haven't seen us in six months! Nobody will mind if we repeat ourselves.

593.speaker: Player

790.speaker: Shadowheart
790.text: Hmm, that is a good one, though I wonder if they'll believe it - you and me against all those cambions? And I actually managed to land a hit with my sacred flame...?

760.speaker: Shadowheart

621.speaker: Player
621.text: We've felled countless kith'raki. They should hear of our victories.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Fear not - my boundless vocabulary can render even the most shopworn anecdote into a thoroughbred knee-slapper.

591.speaker: Shadowheart
591.text: Of course. You know, I think it was your self-confidence that made me fall for you to begin with - that, and that adorable earring of yours.

352.speaker: Shadowheart

286.speaker: Player

718.speaker: Shadowheart

372.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is in a romantic relationship with the player (they arrived at the reunion together). Here, her parents LIVED

60.speaker: Shadowheart

60.context: NodeContext: Addressed to love interest Durge. Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is in a romantic relationship with the player (they arrived at the reunion together). Here, her parents LIVED

463.speaker: Player
463.text: I can pinch you, if you're afraid this isn't real?

319.speaker: Shadowheart
319.text: Save it for when we're alone.
319.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is in a romantic relationship with the player (they arrived at the reunion together). Her parents may or may not have survived at this point,.

214.speaker: Shadowheart
214.text: Anyway, I know it's real. I know we made it. I just wish I could go back in time and reassure the old me that it would all work out. But enough introspection - this is a party.
214.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is in a romantic relationship with the player (they arrived at the reunion together). Her parents may or may not have survived at this point,.

208.speaker: Player
208.text: Your backside is just fine. Trust me - I've been checking regularly.

201.speaker: Shadowheart
201.text: Oh, I've noticed. Ever since I first slipped into my camp garments, I should think.
201.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is in a romantic relationship with the player (they arrived at the reunion together). Her parents may or may not have survived at this point,.

516.speaker: Player
516.text: If you don't think you're up to this, just say the word and I'll make our excuses.

944.speaker: Shadowheart
944.text: You're sweet, but don't worry. After all we've been through, this will be a breeze... just don't leave me alone for too long.
944.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is in a romantic relationship with the player (they arrived at the reunion together). Her parents may or may not have survived at this point,.

622.speaker: Shadowheart
622.text: I've missed wine. Had to resort to making my own cider recently - which isn't bad, don't get me wrong - but a girl can't have fun with apples alone.

230.speaker: Player
230.text: Might I steal a kiss from you?

205.speaker: Shadowheart
205.text: My favourite sort of thievery. Come here...
205.context: NodeContext: Flirty/warm pre-kiss. SH turned from Shar

667.speaker: Shadowheart
667.text: I hope there'll be more of those to come, before dawn creeps up on us.
667.context: NodeContext: contented/romantic post-kiss. SH turned from Shar.

137.speaker: Shadowheart
137.context: NodeContext: contented/romantic post-kiss. SH turned from Shar.

615.speaker: Player
615.text: Might I steal a kiss from you?

1025.speaker: Player
1025.text: Oh I don't know - have you tried juggling them?

544.speaker: Shadowheart
544.text: I suppose it's worth a try - it might keep the animals amused for a while.

652.speaker: Player
652.text: You could have a future in brewing, start your own label maybe - 'Shadowheart's Special Scrumpy'.

412.speaker: Shadowheart
412.text: You might be on to something there... though the name might need work. Somehow it sounds rude, even though I know otherwise.

444.speaker: Player
444.text: Dredged up any more terrible jokes to share?

556.speaker: Shadowheart
556.text: Not with that sort of attitude, I don't.

786.speaker: Shadowheart
786.text: Oh fine, if it gets you to crack a smile.

970.speaker: Player
970.text: Got any more hilarious jokes for me?

763.speaker: Shadowheart
763.text: Oh... what did the amorous boar say to the sow?

833.speaker: Shadowheart
833.text: Oh come on, you loved it. I'll wager I'll overhear you telling that to someone else before the night is out.

103.speaker: Shadowheart
103.text: Come on, oink like a pig and boink - oh you know what I mean!

617.speaker: Player
617.text: If it's something to do with horniness, that makes no sense. Boars have tusks.

673.speaker: Shadowheart
673.text: Oh no, this is far more sophisticated. It has layers.

828.speaker: Shadowheart
828.text: I'll admit it - I miss the sounds of the wilderness at night. You simply don't get that in the city.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: What's it like, leading the Cloister?

873.speaker: Shadowheart
873.text: I hope the sand takes its time slipping through the hourglass - I don't want tonight to end too soon.
873.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart turned from Shar and is now reuniting with the player after six months. In this section, her parents may or may not have survived.

1007.speaker: Shadowheart
1007.text: You know, I never really imagined Withers as much of a party-thrower, but then again I suppose our camps weren't taking care of themselves while we were out gallivanting, were they? There's hidden depths in that loveable husk.

831.speaker: Player
831.text: He's been an asset, no doubt about it.

986.speaker: Shadowheart
986.text: Indeed - healing can only do so much. We'd likely be dead somewhere out in the wilderness if not for him.

345.speaker: Player
345.text: He could stand to be a little less... cryptic, perhaps.

480.speaker: Shadowheart
480.text: Oh no, that's all part of the fun! You know me - I can't resist a bit of mystery.
